result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jocelyn Dashae Joe in court.  Attorney Allegra L Berry in court for Jocelyn Dashae Joe.  Attorney Kyle Olsen in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Berry filed a motion to withdraw as counsel. Colloquy w/ defn; defn wishes to have a new lawyer appointed. Defn advised of rights and right to a lawyer. CT makes findings and grants motion. CT allows Atty Berry to w/d and orders SPD to appoint successor counsel. CT directs Atty Berry to cooperate with the transfer of the file. Bail cont. SPD notified f/w.

records.addlTxt:
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards JJ, BM, IM, & AW.
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
Trial Judge - Br 5

9:32 AM Defendant Jocelyn Dashae Joe in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
